The Christian sword and buckler, or, A letter by D. Sprint to a man seuen yeares grieuously afflicted in conscience and fearefully possessed by the Diuel very comfortable and commodious to withstand the assaults of Sathan. Sprint, John, d. 1623.
[20] p.
Printed by B. Alsop for Samuel Rand and are to be sold at his shop at Holborne Bridge, London : 1623.
Signatures: A⁸(-A1) B⁴ (last leaf blank). Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.
=======
